I am curious under what circumstances the file ssytem is too slow to clean up after itself?

I have some code that crawls files and directories, so to test this functionality I create the hierachy right in the TestCase.  I use a special createFile(...) method to, of course, create the file, as well as track it in a Vector to be cleaned up on every tearDown();

Would it be better to increment the root directory name and then delete all the structures at the end of all test cases?  Or would this present a similar problem when joining multiple tests from multiple test classes (provided they also access the file system in a similar manner).  

andrew f

```````````````````````
A common idea is to kill a folder on the file system after every test, in order to start with a "clean slate". Unfortunately, the
tests are too fast for the file system, so the file system isn't clean
before the next test starts.
```````````
